website_summaries.verdict: This WiFi extender was designed with user-friendly features to make it simple to install and use.
pros: LED indicators on the unit help you find the best location in your home to put the extender
cons: Users report that while speeds improve with the extender, they're often still not as fast as when you're right next to the router

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I changed my 5 star rating to a 1 star. At first, it worked perfectly. It was easy t set up and booted my signal from the second floor to the basement. Since then, however, it hasn’t been working at all. It constantly kicks us off the network and requires the password every single time we try to re-connect. When I enter the password it tells me it’s incorrect. I’m very disappointed with this product and, of course, my return window is closed so now I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: ACH

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to setup  - Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by xfinity, this POS is totally impossible to setup. I am a software engineer.. Did not show up on my network, xfinity does not have wpa setup, so you have to use the web browser. Will not show up. Used the ethernet cable..connecting to the recommended web address just timed out. No network installation assistant mentioned in documentation found anywhere to download. 1 last try to netgear tech support and it's going back. If I as a 30 year computer pro can not get it to work out of the box, imagine your problems! Total disaster.. find something better..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 90 kbps to 2.3 Mbps
customer_reviews.text: This was seriously worth the money. After reading some of the bad reviews I was a bit hesitant but I decided to give this extender a try. I am so very glad I did; it has boosted the wifi speed from 90 kbps to 2.3 Mbps. Whereas before it took me a solid 20 seconds to load a regular webpage, I can now stream Netflix with no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now have WIFI access anywhere in our backyard as far as 55 feet from the interior-located NetGear extender
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this produce because our WIFI connection was iffy when we went out on our back deck (about 35 straight-line feet from the router which had to pass through 3 interior walls and 1 exterior wall). After following all of the instructions for placing the extender using WPS, I moved it even closer to our deck (a total of about 33 straight-line feet from the router, and passing through 4 interior walls). Now I can get a good signal on the deck and a decent signal from anywhere in our backyard which includes a maximum straight-line of 55 feet passing through 3 exterior walls.
customer_reviews.author: CalTex

customer_reviews.title: This is a HORRIBLE product and even WORSE support that I’ve been battling ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a HORRIBLE product and even WORSE support that I’ve been battling trying to get help just to get it to work and NOTHINGHAS HELPED ! The support is IMPOSSIBLE TO SPEAK TO and I’ve literally spent at least 6 -8 hours combined first trying to make it work and now trying to RETURN THE PROCUCTS (which is seemingly impossible).
customer_reviews.author: Buddha

customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me. In addition to this, when I tried getting assistance through "chat" I was asked for my phone number and told I would receive a call back. I received the call and was instructed to down load some program. I couldn't understand the technician. I was placed on hold and after 5 min, the technician returned and told me to call back in 2 hours. Over the course of a week I was called everyday.... From India::(
customer_reviews.author: Light worker in progress

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a terrible time getting this set up. Then when I called support, they asked to get into my computer. Once there they said I had all kinds of outside devices plugged into my computer and that they could clean it up for me. So I let them. They charged me for that service, but since I had an old computer, I thought maybe it was valid. Well I had my computer hit by lightening and got a new computer. Had a hard time setting it up again. Called them once again. They couldn't get it set up. They told me the same thing....They needed to clean it up....for a charge....I said no thank you. Won't buy netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: Nana55

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt trust it.
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent for 2.5 months then for some unknown reason would not access the internet. No mods or changes were made. All status LED's were correct. I went through the setup several times after factory resetting and still had the same problem. I see where others have had this same exact problem with no resolve others had MAC filtering on in their router and then disabled or configured it correctly. Im trashing it and will be purchasing a Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: Frank III

customer_reviews.title: Relatively cheap (as a used item) to extend home WIFI
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used item to extend the boundary of my WIFI network without having to run additional cable or invest in another router. It was somewhat tricky to set up, but after experimentation (and referring online documentation), I was able to get it to work as an extender rather than an Access Point. Less configuration involved. Not a 100% solution but it does provide enough signal extension for my particular application (enabling WIFI enabled home irrigation controller located in garage to access home network.)
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a hassle to set up, then it worked ok, not great, for a few weeks, then just quit. Showed a flashing green power light, which was not an error covered in any manual or instructions. From the user forums, probably corrupted firmware. Could not get new firmware to load manually. Contacted customer support, got a worthless reply to "reset" it, which I had already tried and told them in the initial message did not work. When I recontacted customer support, they refused to reply to my messages. Bottom line: defective product, no customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kuczek

customer_reviews.title: Works about 60% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 4 months now. When it works, it's great. However, it works about 60% of the time. The rest of the time the little light is red and nothing is happening. So not reliable. I ended up purchasing Extollo LanSocket1500 to extend the signal and a Netgear Nighthawk x6s to spread wifi to another 2000 sq ft of my house. It cost more and I have two networks now, but the signal is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia N.

customer_reviews.title: Caused network degradation in my home
customer_reviews.text: After I installed the device in a downstairs room, which hadn't been receiving a wifi signal, I did get a wifi signal in that room. However, other rooms in the house experienced a noticeable decline in signal strength where before they had been fine. Once I removed the device from the wall, the rest of the house was restored. Still have the same problem but am poorer for having paid for this.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Not what it said to be!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a new and unused product. The unit had been previously used and repackaged as new. When setting up the product I noticed smudges on the face of the product. I ignored it and continued to set it up. It required a name change on the Netgear extender. However, the name had already been changed. I reset the product back to the factory setting and proceeded. The unit would not hold contact. Confirming why the previous buyer returned the unit. Obvious misconception. I returned the unit without and received a refund without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: joseph milton

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions and weep
customer_reviews.text: As usual, the dicumentation is unclear. After you save email, a password, and two lame secret questions, you can’t login as the setup (used wifi extender option) instructs. You have to go to your main browser after connecting to your new netgear ext hotspot to complete setup. I am not a newby but It took me three factory resets to get it all going. I liked the rather complete led status lights. I also immediately created my own SSID and password. But WAIT! After you’ve entered this stuff - you MUST login to your hotspot BEFORE clicking CONTINUE. But then you are in your way.
customer_reviews.author: carmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Unit had been working, changed router unit would not repeat wifi tried different options still did not connect. I had a older unit that worked fine after the new router install. I went into customer support chat and they had tech support call me back within less that a min. They said that I had a spoofing virus and I could pay $180 to $480 for protection based on number of years. I think I was hacked. I have double checked everything and is ok . I cannot believe Netgear would allow this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived and set up in minutes
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived today and I set it up immediately. The instructions were clear and although there were some differences from the paper instructions and online instructions, it was pretty easy. The only confusing part was the last step as when I clicked 'continue' I received an error 404 page not found but it was complete. The first place I plugged the extender in worked and the Internet ran fine. The only thing I didn't understand (but completed) was connecting all the devices during setup and not afterwards. Haven't tried to add another device since installation. If there are any problems I'll update this review later
customer_reviews.author: Lisa T

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, a little complicated to get it online and activate it
customer_reviews.text: This extender did the job and brought strong Wi-Fi into a room that was not getting a good signal. You have to use a genie online to connect it to your existing Wi-Fi. It acts like a mini router. Some confusion in the instructions and ultimately you have to call the service number and have them walk you through it. Representative wanted me to give remote control of my computer which I refused. And then another representative guided me through a different route to the Netgear extender Genie and I was able to get it online. It works good though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible signal speed next to router.
customer_reviews.text: had horrible wifi speeds right next to router and 30 ft away just the same [placed it between router and weak wifi location], only a 200mb internet, getting only 8.76/sec download. Yes I understand extendee cuts speed by half but only 8.76/sec download speed?
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: This extender continues to lose signal and provides no additional signal. I have switch back to my main Wifi and now all this piece of equipment does is suck electricity until I decide to pull it out of the wall and throw it away. Update 6 months in I threw it in the trash. would rather struggle with dead spot than a wifi extender that goes out all the time
customer_reviews.author: Seiff

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I had been procrastinating on getting a wi-fi extender for years, even though I knew we needed one for downstairs in our house. I had this idea that it would be really complicated and frustrating to install, and I ordered this one because it said it came with an app that made it easy to install. They were right! I installed it all by myself (without having to ask the teenagers for help) and it took about 10 minutes from opening the box to using the extended wi-fi. So excited because it extends the wi-fi range sufficiently that we can now use our devices on our screened porch as well as by the pool. Well worth the money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Someone's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed! So tired of sitting outside with my iPad and not being able to get any wifi, and our router is newer and with a good range. My husband could use his iPhone and I could use my Droid, but nothing with my iPad, so I researched and researched to find what I needed without spending an arm and a leg. I found this, followed instructions, at first a little confusing, but worked it out and found the perfect spot, plugged it in and WOW! What a difference no more dead spots outside and now even when I FaceTime my sister I don't lose the connection!
customer_reviews.author: tberry

customer_reviews.title: stop working on me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this extender a few months ago and it just now stopped working. I called user support today to see if they could help through their website they had me go through a few items and they said that the extender was broken. I spent $61 on this item and it only lasted about six months be very careful buying this I do not recommend this item and user support will not help you they will just say it's broken and hang up.
customer_reviews.author: vjm

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi Extender!
customer_reviews.text: I have been disappointed with my Internet cable providers WiFi router so purchased this extender. I have a one story, 1900 sq foot, 2 bedroom home with lanai and pool. Installation instructions excellent and completed in a few minutes. Increased range and strength is exceptional. Recommend downloading free, easy to use Netgear WiFi Analyzer app. Easy to use and easy to understand results. I tested before and after and was amazed. Dead spots became strong spots. All areas of home and yard strong signal. Can't believe I waited so long to try this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Boosterf
customer_reviews.text: I needed a booster to get to my computer which is 55 ft away from my Hughes wi-fy router. Called Hughes and they said I was 5-10 feet to far away from their router. Received unit, plugged in, waited 10 minutes or so for the router to find and match up with booster, moved it to a location closer to computer and works great. ( note, Hughes satellite router and this booster are located in finished basement while computer on 1st floor)
customer_reviews.author: Larry McArtor

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Get It To Work
customer_reviews.text: When my previous extender stopped working (after many months of service), I decided to upgrade with this Netgear device. Unfortunately, after two and a half hours of repeated, diligent attempts, I wasn't able to get it connected. Yes, I followed the directions to the letter, but encountered too many roadblocks for completion. This may be due to my own lack of technical acumen. However, I found the experience so terribly frustrating, I simply threw it in the trash. I hate throwing money down the drain, but this gadget made me that angry. I'll never, ever buy another Netgear product.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT IMPROVE SIGNAL AT ALL IF ANYTHING IT'S WORST.
customer_reviews.text: Worst extender on the market. I read all these reviews how great this product was and how it help extend customers Wifi. That is so far from the truth. This product continuously lag with supposedly great signal. My internet works way faster without it than it does with it. The wifi constantly loading when I use this product. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Daneley

customer_reviews.title: Not good for video conferencing
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works fine for general internet browsing and emailing but does NOT work well for streaming or video conferencing. My video calls always freeze and I am forced to relocate closer to the main router. So annoying.
customer_reviews.author: A. White

customer_reviews.title: Beware of “Amazon Warehouse” - broken, worthless, used.
customer_reviews.text: So let me get this straight - a device is returned because it doesn’t work. So throw it in the “Amazon warehouse” - sell it for less, so then I get to deal with a still broken worthless device. Bad plan Amazon. My bad too. They said “oh the box is just opened and dented”. I got to spend over an hour with tech support- so they could tell me it is a defective unit. Infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: MMB IN NJ

customer_reviews.title: Works about 20% of the time, followed instruction on ...
customer_reviews.text: Works about 20% of the time, followed instruction on paper and YouTube but didn’t work. I called the customer service number and was frightened into buying protection for my wi fi. I was told my Wi-Fi was not secure and with my weak signal all of my information was vulnerable. So $400.00 later I’m protected and still have a sluugest Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extended WIFI in a large home within minutes
customer_reviews.text: This was so super easy to set up. I have a similiar Netgear and it finally died. Had it for over a year. I got this one and it was ready to go in 5 min. I just plugged it in the room with my router. Gave it a few minutes for lights to turn green and detect my router. Entered my wifi password and the extender showed up in my wifi settings on my laptop and IPad. I unplugged the router and moved it to another outlet closer to my husbands office. (on the other side of house) He has an excellent signal. Couldnt be without this.
customer_reviews.author: CatrineTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Very goog  wi-Fi extender!
customer_reviews.text: Netgear N300 works very well! It's extend my wifi range by it lest 5 times the distance, with much better reception went from two bars to five bars. My range was about 30 feet with work reception now is a good 120 to 150 feet in all directions from the Wi-Fi extender. I would definitely recommend this Netgear N300 wallplug Wi-Fi extender. 👍
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend something for a little more $$. I don't know if it was the dogs knocking this out of the wall, overall age, or something else... But this repeater has lost most of its function in the past couple of months. We purchased a new one and away we go! This repeater did work pretty solid for a few years, so I do NOT have bad things to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil W

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the Optilink
customer_reviews.text: I had some cheap extender with really bad software. It worked for a bit then quit. Couldn't get it to reconnect. This Netgear works much better. Software is reasonably easy to use. WPS didn't connect to my Netgear router, I had to manually set it up, but it was easy. Updated the firmware, that went smoothly too. Signal is super strong. I'm completely on the other side of the house and have full strength. The real router is actually closer to me but the extender has a stronger signal.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hassler

customer_reviews.title: great product. Easy to install and get running to boost my internet.
customer_reviews.text: Supremely easy to follow for a novice computer guy. Instructions walked me through very quickly how to get this set up, and i was up and running in minutes. Indicators are easy to read and show the proper range/ installation limitations for my personal wifi range. Price was unbelievable through amazon Prime and was able to get this high quality item for a steal. Supremely happy and have boosted my home signal with hardly any effort. Will need to monitor to see how reliable it lasts especially with more people that may show up and family usage in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A Dulac

customer_reviews.title: works ok not great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up but the range extension is fair to poor. I expected better. The range extender on the 1st floor with the router in the basement barely provides a usable signal on the 2nd floor of a small 2 story house. Disappointing. Also the extender seems to work better with PC's than with Mac's, we have both.
customer_reviews.author: tom b

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these products and one never worked at all. Spoke with Netgear a few times trying to get support and they were rude and not helpful at all. I would recommend any other wifi extender than Netgear. Just my review of them. I also had purchased their router in the past and one would think they would be a little more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry L

customer_reviews.title: Very strong signal
customer_reviews.text: After some initial problems getting the unit up and running I was finally able to finish installing the Range Finder and put it to use. The coverage and strength of signal are a vast improvement over the unit that it replaced. So 4 stars for it. Minus 1 for the time it took to set up and the time wasted trying to call Net Gear for help (phone number didn't work). It took a while but I was finally able to navigate their website and got the information I needed to finish the setup.
customer_reviews.author: JRiley

customer_reviews.title: recommend this
customer_reviews.text: NETGEAR N300 Wall Plug Version Wi-Fi Range: great little range extender. easy to configure. I use an apple router and had no problem hooking up and extending the range of my wifi. I put the extender outside on my porch and I now have great internet at my pool which is at least forty yards from this extender. This outside extender is about 50 ft. from the Router and the signal is passing thru doors and walls. Would recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive, weak signal, you have to restart it over and over again ... STAY AWAY FROM THIS ..... DEVICE!!
customer_reviews.text: Poor signal. Does NOT cover hard to reach áreas. Extender only (not AP or Router function) Worst piece of .... Hardware!! After 20 or 25 mins the router will drop connections and make source wifi to drop connections too... I followed all the instrucions and have the latest firmware... I can't believe than even NEXXT range extenders perform better. UPDATE... I finally fixed the issue... took the NETGEAR range extender and destroyed it with my own hands!! I've never been so happy after all the issues with this piece of ... hardware. This thing doesn't deserve even one star GO FOR LINKSYS!! More expensive but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C5

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: 75 y.o female that’s not technically savvy in the least but, I cannot believe how easy this was to set up. The directions were a little difficult to understand but after reading them through a couple of times, I took the plunge and started the setup process. In 5 minuets time I had completed the process and had it plugged into the room that always had poor, if nonexistent, connection and was good to go. I’ve never had full strength WiFi connection until now. This is a great product that deserves the 5 stars I gave it.
customer_reviews.author: Older and Wiser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have bought for a barn game room. We have another one we bought for our horse barn. These Realtek work great for keepjj in f a great signal to text, receive phone calls and browse the web. If your doing gaming or work related stuff it might lag a little. Overall we like them!
customer_reviews.author: KJG

customer_reviews.title: Fixed all my issues!
customer_reviews.text: I have been working from home, using internet telephone and online meetings often. I kept having issues with delayed video streams, participants suddenly muted even though everyone else could hear them, and dropped calls. After upgrading my internet speed I was still having these issues. This device fixed all that! It was very easy to install, and I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Michael K Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, i was able to contact Netgear customer service ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. But one caveat: I bought this as an Amazon Warehouse Deal, and Amazon hadn't re-set the name or password of the previous owner. So when I plugged it in, it automatically showed up as his name and password, which of course I didn't know. The manual explained how to do a factory re-set--but not how to do the hard reset required to rid of the name and password. Fortunately, i was able to contact Netgear customer service for that information. UPDATE: I also discovered that this seller was not a Netgear authorized reseller, so the warranty would not be honored.
customer_reviews.author: Harriet

customer_reviews.title: Works great, now I get wifi over my entire back yard.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to extended my wifi out to my camper that is approx. 55 feet from my home. It works perfect, the wifi is just as strong outside as it is inside.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Anders

customer_reviews.title: Great price and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The wifi extender signal is working great for us. I had a bit of an issue setting it up, and tried to call the company but was on hold way too long. Long story short our internet provider came to the house for another issue and the technician was able to get it set up for me. No problems at all since and I am getting excellent signal in other part of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen F

customer_reviews.title: extended network through an additional wall. full bars 15 feet away.
customer_reviews.text: Without this product, my computer send/receive averages about 0Kbps send and 0Kpbs receive. With this product, it is about 8Mbps/250Kpbs. This downloads files off the internet at about 0.9-1.2MB/s in the off hours when i supposedly have a 50Mbps connection from the wall. It feels like i'm living in 2013 with the speeds, but beats running networking cable through the walls. Setup was pretty easy with the quick guide. Be prepared to enter in your network password before you start.
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Very Easy to Set Up. Just Plug it into a 110volt outlet by your Router. Push the Power Button. Then Push Your Routers "WPS" Button. It starts to Blink and within two minutes Push the Netgear "WPS Button and when the Router Link LED Stays Green your Netgear is Programed. Now move it to the Area where your Signal is Week, plug it into a 110volt outlet. On your I Pad or I Phone go to your WiFi Settings and look for your Network name that ends with EXT and put in your Routers Password and your Done.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Silecchio

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT to extend your WIFI! Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to extend the WIFI signal in the house...my router is upstairs, so I got this for my kitchen to extend the WIFI to my deck/downstairs. Works great-gives you better WIFI outside. It was simple to set up. You plug in and it really just automatically connects. My computer recognized it right away & I set up a password (used the same one as my home WIFI) & voila! I have better connection downstairs and out on my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your $. As other reviews have stated, it is easy to set up and could work for you for a little while, but then it will likely stop working and be nothing more than a paperweight for you. Mine worked for 3 months with few problems, now it doesn't work at all. When I was looking at the statistics, it said "link down" for LAN. I'm not sure what is causing this, but the firmware is up to date and the regular wifi is working just fine. Guess I'll just stick with that and throw this useless piece of gear away.
customer_reviews.author: Weltschmerz

customer_reviews.title: It works great! As soon as We set it up the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great! As soon as We set it up the room on the other side of the house could receive internet. It didn't get there before purchasing the Netgear N300 Wall Plug. The smart tv started working and anything that runs on wifi picked it up. The cable company wanted me to pay for another modem monthly. But the tech that was trying to help me told me to get this. He said that he had gotten it and it solved the problems. So I bought it and I'm so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy A.

customer_reviews.title: Small and effective but only for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for our house, we have a long house that would only give me one bar and now I have full bars and it makes web surfing a whole lot easier. I am very pleased at the size and effectiveness of this device.** This was my original post but after owning this for like 3 months it just stopped working. While I had it when it DID work it would drop the signal all the time and was a hassle. I am coming on here to change the rating because I feel ripped off for sure not I am stuck with a box that doesn't do anything. Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Devin Ammerman

customer_reviews.title: 2 of 3 units worked fine.  NetGear tech support is not accessible.
customer_reviews.text: $500 for a new Netgear router and 3 of these extenders. Two connected pretty smoothly but the third one wouldn't go, regardless of the installation path chosen. Netgear's product support is an inpenetrable fortress. They have a vast moat of useless information surrounding it and if you can cross the moat, there is no help for you within, unless you want to be tethered to a phone, waiting for Santa Tech.
customer_reviews.author: The Galvinator

customer_reviews.title: read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: one thing I love about amazon, is the reviews. I was going to buy another option, but I am so glad that I read the reviews and did some comparing. This is working fantastic. It was really easy to set up! it took me a few times, but then it all worked out. be patient and it almost seem a little confusing. my kids are truly happy. we have full Bars on the other side of the house!! and out to our Garage!. NO MORE BUFFERING! - THANK YOU NETGEAR!
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: More useful than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a one-off (admittedly non-standard) usage of temporarily bridging the 50' gap between house and barn for wired ethernet devices - but I find myself more and more dependent on it for normal WiFi expansion. Easy to install and configure - just pair it with the cable modem and then plug it in where needed.
customer_reviews.author: Strictly Amateur

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream...bought TWO!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! 4200 sqft house, not including finished basement. Our router is in the office on first floor and the upstairs and basement struggled to get sufficient WiFi to power workout equipment/Netflix in basement or upstairs. Paired two units to our router then moved one upstairs and one to the basement and now we have amazing fast WiFi through the whole house. Only regret is waiting so long to get them.
customer_reviews.author: EAC

customer_reviews.title: Easy connection and positive results.
customer_reviews.text: These WiFi estenders are as so easy to install. I’m using these in an industrial IOT setting connecting the Blink camera to the sync module. They are fantastic in that the WPS feature works every time in some pretty touch situations with a lot of interference from other wave links. I’ve tried so many other options to do the same job and they either don’t work at all or create their own interference. A winner that I hope and pray NETGEAR never changes.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Straight forward and simple to use. Put it near your home WiFi router. Press a couple of buttons yhen go plug it in someplace about halfway between your router and the part of your home where you need the WiFi and you are done. Log into the device from your WiFi screen on your device (tv, phone). Your WiFi will have an _ext appended to it, example: home_ext. Done.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nelxon

customer_reviews.title: Weak coverage...you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got it up and running (self taught IT person) and I no longer have spotty bar strength which equals weak coverage on 3rd level master bedroom since the Hubs have network setup in the Bat Cave. ;-) I just had this for a week so I can’t comment on durability and I’m using as a WiFi Extender so can’t comment on versatility although according to product details, there is another way to use
customer_reviews.author: S. W-C

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We were having a horrible time trying to stay connected to wifi even when we had our devices close to the router. THIS WIFI EXTENDER WORKS GREAT! We now have a strong signal. The only thing that you may have to do is reconnect from time to time and that is very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Range extender, not so much!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell much difference in the reception than before I installed this although the green light is on and it says "excellent" reception for that color. My house is long front the front room to the back room where the internet comes in, and has thick plaster walls (built in 1890) At least that's what the tech said and said that an range extender should fix it, well, it hasn't so I guess I will have to move my desk top and line closer to the front of the house as I still have problems using laptop or tablet in the front of the house even with the wifi on. Not entirely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jomar

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well although you do have to set it up on each device you use. For some reason my computer does not default to my original wifi signal and I have to change it manually each time I go out of signal range. It might be my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie J

customer_reviews.title: Probably buyer error but it didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: This could be buyer error, but I thought it would amplify your current wireless router, but it doesn’t. It makes a new wireless connection from your original, but will only transfer if the original isn’t strong enough. I wanted it for baby items, but didn’t like the idea that I had to switch connections. I just wanted something to stretch my signal from downstairs to an upstairs corner room, but this wasn’t what I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Apple AirPort Express which is really hard to install Wi-Fi signal did not stay in that looked into Netgear bought one it has easy to install operated perfectly since day one. Great signal at the other end of the house. I would definitely recommend this to all
customer_reviews.author: Kennyken

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 month...Then..slow speed, dropped connection. TOTAL JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for ATT Uverse based on reviews. (I have a detached garage as my office) It worked nicely for about a month... Then I noticed connection speed went down to 5Mbps, Not able to listen to any music without buffer. I have to reconnect every other day. It doesn’t make sense why would the speed would reduce in time... Absolutely mind boggling.. Making long story short this thing SUCKS! I guess they are going for Better than nothing... #Shame
customer_reviews.author: Turk Akbay

customer_reviews.title: Extend your Internet Reach...Effortlessly!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to extend wireless internet coverage to other areas of your home or office, this is an excellent product to do so. In addition to our wireless router, we have two N300s in our home and our coverage is excellent throughout. The Netgear N300 is very easy to set up and should only take a few minutes. We're very pleased with it based on ease of set up, price and coverage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leslie

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our router is on one end of the house and the PlayStation 4 is on the other end. We plugged the extender in right in the middle of the house. I've read reviews that the one button setup didn't work. I tried it anyhow and it worked for us! It was setup in two mins. We now have wifi coverage throughout our house. It's highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M.

customer_reviews.title: There is a God
customer_reviews.text: The wifi did not do justice on the far side of the house. I had bought a dinky cheap extender (wavlink) that did not even connect to the wifi router we had. I did my research and took a gulp and purchased this one. SUPER HAPPY. the process did not take long and I officially now have given my wifi a little boost. YAY! no more phone messages saying i use up data because of wifi gaps
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the range
customer_reviews.text: We finally have wifi in a part of our house and into our backyard that used to be non existent. Very happy with the range. Sometimes my phone picks up this connection where I get full wifi off the regular router. A lot of people complain about it being slow, but that hasn't been a problem for us yet. We have an Apple TV connected to this Netgear Range Extender and have had no problems watching High Definition Netflix or whatever other streaming applications. Running plex, streaming at 1080p has resulted in zero problems. I would definitely recommend this to anyone having spotty wifi connection in parts of their hosue, or outside.
customer_reviews.author: Nardomang

customer_reviews.title: No Warranty, ( Well some Warranty)
customer_reviews.text: Product died 11 months into the 12 month warranty. I called Netgear to return it, but they can't help you do that unless you buy the extended support option for 89.99, or the one time support option for 49.99. What utter crap! So really there is a 90 warranty. Just buy a D-Link and you will be happier. :: UPDATE so after leaving this review I was contact by Netgear and the problem was resolved without cost to me, So I am moving my review up to 3 stars, I don't understand why I had to leave a negative review to get access to the warrant, however the product is working great now.
customer_reviews.author: The Hart Family

customer_reviews.title: Product works great, but setup was a puzzle to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: After trying the setup instructions and not getting anywhere, I took the advise I saw on another review and plugged the unit directly into my computer using a CAT5 ethernet cable. It connected immediately and the correct setup webpage loaded automatically. After that, setup was a breeze. It's too bad they don't include a small ethernet pigtail in the box so people could actually get this thing working out of the box. If that was the case, my review would be 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with ADT Pulse System
customer_reviews.text: I tried to purchase an extender for my ADT pulse system, As I entered ADT Pulse Wifi Extender and the part that is recommended, this one came up. I purchased and then tried to install- no go. Had to return it. The 3 stars is for the quick shipping, that is all.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient product support.  Directions did not work for iOS.
customer_reviews.text: Directions did not work for IOS. Did anybody at NETGEAR try to use their directions? On phone waiting for support for 2 1/2 hours. We should all expect good directions and reasonably fast customer support. Was pretty easy to walk through when I eventually did get help and the device now works fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nadell

customer_reviews.title: You deserve this, buy now and be happy!
customer_reviews.text: Our living room was a weak wifi spot for our handheld mobile devices, and the AppleTV, due to the 1,000 sf distance of walls, turns, lighting, from our router. Signal at the hot tub was 0 to 1 bar, depending on wind. After the 90 second WPS install, signal strength on my phone was full bars and download speeds more than doubled. Before this was installed, there would be a 5 to 10 minute buffering period if we tried to stream a movie during prime time. Now the living room AppleTV is like watching a dvd. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AOW1

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: For what I needed this item has worked wonderfully. My home is more or less an L shape, with the main router at the top of the L, and my bedroom on the second floor at the tip of the short end. Internet varied between spotty and nonexistent. With this extender I can browse quite easily in the far corner of my room if I wanted! I haven't tried streaming anything on it, and I don't play MMOs so I can't speak to it's ability to carry that kind of internet at any speed, but just the usual browsing is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kitta

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up, Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Setup using the WPS option did not work. After a factory reset the browser method was straight forward and got it up and running quickly. Our browser is in a corner of the basement in our 26 x 40 two story colonial. This device, when placed on the first floor where the browser signal is strongest (directly above the router), gives us much better coverage where we wanted it in our second floor bedroom on the same end of the house. We have decent coverage on most of the second floor. For really good coverage on the end of the house farthermost from this device we'd need another one to act as a repeater.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Korn

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to order this because of some of the reviews, but I'm glad I did. I needed to extend coverage to an area of my house where the wifi signal was poor. I followed the instructions exactly and set up the extender. I had zero problems and I now have a wifi signal throughout the house. It was pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Halal Pork

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for extending your wifi around the house or office!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for extending your wifi around the house or office! Very easy set up through my AT&T wireless internet with the included instructions. Took me about 5 minutes to get it up and working! Our router is in the living room and my office is in the back of our home which was bringing me down to 3/4 bars of wifi signal strength. After installing the extender and plugging it into an outlet in my office, I immediately got 5 bars and boosted up my internet speed. I highly recommend this product but would check the reviews to see if it's compatible with your router as a couple people left comments that it didn't work with their router.
customer_reviews.author: MauiBoi59

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had purchased a router with more than enough power to reach the outer limits of my modestly sized home, but found I would occasionally drop signal to my tablets and Amazon Fire TV box (which I adore, btw!) in our family room. The Netgear N300 was the perfect solution and fit my budget well. The device is easy to connect and has never dropped it's connection to my router. The room where I had previously experienced loss of wifi is now powered with a full 5 bars of signal thanks to the Netgear N300. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BLRO

customer_reviews.title: Gave us about 50 additional feet from full strength signal.
customer_reviews.text: Works and setup was very easy. I had to set it up via browser, but it was still easy and felt directions were clear. I only gave it 4 stars because unfortunately it doesn't tell you how far it will extend. I found it only extends about 50 additional linear feet from the devices full strength signal. Needed something that extended 150 feet. However, if 50 or less does it for you I would recommend it. A plus side is the Ethernet jack that allows you to plug a non wireless device in and use it for internet. Worked great for my connecting my old computer tower to the internet to use with my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Set up was a snap - and it really works.
customer_reviews.text: Technology should be easy to set up and it should “just work.” That was my experience with the Netgear N300 range extender. My WiFi was just weak enough in my workshop that music and internet radio would stop playing often. I plugged this in the garage about 2/3 of the distance from my router and it gives me a strong signal in my workshop now.
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Set up the extender and plugged it in 24 feet from router. Extender indicates it is getting a strong signal, etc. But, it will not transmit (extend) the signal to an area only 45 feet away---significantly less than advertised. I've rebooted and repeated the setup process twice. It worked for a few hours and then stopped working. The warranty does not cover anything beyond 3 months. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Works ... but it too a while
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought a name brand and paid the extra to be sure it would work as advertised. Once I got it set up, it has worked well, but set-up was a challenge. The instruction manual is very clear, but I continually ran into problems linking my router with the extender. After multiple tries and resets, I contacted customer service. It took several hours on the chat line, but it turns out because I already had a hexadecimal password on my router, I didn't need to generate a new one for the extender. Once we got that ironed out, everything is fine. I know it's rather technical, but somehow the manual should have clarified that.
customer_reviews.author: BobInWi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! Brought my dead spot to life! Easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: Netgear, you have done it again! I purchased this to extend the poor wifi signal in the den. Our devices were super slow as far as web browsing due to concrete block construction. Then, along came this little miracle! I plugged it in and followed the simple instructions; within minutes, the laptop in the den was surfing the Internet lightning fast as if it was right next to the router! In addition, the wireless printer now prints instantly with no waiting! And you can't beat the price. I will be ordering more in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Adds range to your wifi but setup may take a bit of time
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to get wifi in the bathroom. Current range was not working and causing me to lose connections while deuce-deuce and playing games on phone. Plugged this thing in and tried the push button sync, which normally works with other devices, but this function did not work. Perhaps user error? Had to connect to the wifi and goto this devices setup webpage and connect that way. My only complaint is that this does not create the same network name in your house but a new network name with the extension of _EXT. So now I have to have both connections saved to my phone to connect. It works for its purpose as no connection drops in the bathroom anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Simpson

customer_reviews.title: ... product absolutely works as advertised and it is extremely easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This product absolutely works as advertised and it is extremely easy to set up. I would have given it a 41/2 if I could because the performance is a bit slow but they told us that up front. Still it is fast enough if you want one streaming video at a time - and it's fine for data and music. It is much cheaper than a high priced modem - and comes in handy when you have guests. Here's a tip: If your primary WiFi signal is on channel 1, choose channel 6 or 11 for your extender That way, one signal woun't interfere with the other. Also, you are less likely to interfere with your neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Chucksz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!! Really it is. I've received it two days after I ordered the device. My nephew set it up and since then I don't have problems with the internet on my TV or computers. I can connect them to the you tube or Netflix and watch the movies and the news on a stream without the interruption of "loading". Great purchase and the price totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: BMQ

customer_reviews.title: Product is a waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: It deserves a zero. I followed the direction on the book. It didn't work. I contacted customer support. Because you don't work with the same person, whoever picks up the email is different each time and they don't read the previous messages. Aside from my frustration with customer service, the product arrived defective. After 4 days of trying to make it work, I gave up and sent it back. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Maimutzacelmare

customer_reviews.title: does what I need it  to  do
customer_reviews.text: i have owned this a year. works great in our house. i have DSL service through our phone carrier. modem/router is in room on eastside of house. i put the Net gear N300 in the outlet in the laundry room to boost the Wi-Fi signal to our bonus room and to the driveway area. The distance from the modem/router to the Net Gear N300 is about 20 feet and 3 walls between them. I get a 4 bar signal from the Net Gear N300 that extends another 30 feet and through another wall (so i get 50 feet through 4 walls).
customer_reviews.author: Honest Jon

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it's supposed to do and is reliable
customer_reviews.text: This things works great. I had other problems with my TP-link extender always losing connection. I set this thing up two weeks ago and have forgot about it. Yes the speeds are slower, but using common sense that's what happens when you are routing your connection through another device. But it's plenty fast enough for my TV to be streaming and at the same time on my ipad with no troubles whatsoever. Setup took about 5 minutes, which included reading the manual. Programming with the WPS button took about 1 minute. I'm very happy with the device and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmmm......
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews and my experience, I assume this product is a "hit or miss" depending on your setup??? 1) The reviewer that commented on the NetGear customer service access is spot-on. I can't comment on the quality of said service, because I was unable to successfully contact them. For a sizeable company, this is interesting. 2) My experience: Tried both the WPS setup (failed), then a manual initial setup (failed)....AND, the latter attempt led to failure of my combination modem/wireless router. ISP was called, troubleshooting with technichal support unsuccessful (including a "hard reset") .... had to take router in to local office and exchange.... replacement modem/router works fine. Oh well, live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Boobalooba

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product. I bought it to extend the reach of my wifi to an outside wireless camera. That didn't happen, but inside my house it does provide a stronger signal at the far end of my house. Guess I was trying to reach too far with it. The WORSE thing is, during setup you must connect to a Netgear website to finish the install. I never could connect from my PC. After trying for a couple of days with no luck on my PC, I tried with my cell phone and it worked. So, just keep trying other devices to connect.
customer_reviews.author: KyTom

customer_reviews.title: netgear N300 wall plug extender.
customer_reviews.text: Never stable. All green lights on wireless and router lights but client light goes from green to red periodically. It cuts my wireless router signal in half!! Netgear doesn't state this on the box. If you have 40 Mbps internet this might not be a problem but with about 7 mbps it ruins streaming and we get lots of buffering. On the extender signal there is only about 1 or 2 Mbps signal. Am looking for a better unit and will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a economical price. It was very easy to install. It is a least 2000 sq ft distance from my modem and is working as if next to it. I bought to extend the WiFi in my 3000 sq ft home. It’s at least 6 device using the connection at one time. I acre from my home I still have at least 3 bars. Can’t beat it! Wish I had bout one sooner
customer_reviews.author: GINA

customer_reviews.title: JUST NO.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one to write a bad review however this piece of equipment has given us SO many issues with the internet and the connection. When you call in they won’t help you unless you’ve purchased Tech Support - Customer service is just as bad- DO NOT RECOMMEND at all!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and excellent reception!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to buy this wifi extender to fix the issue of drops while listening Pandora in my kitchen. The router and modem are in an upstairs office, and the kitchen is on the other side of the house. Set up was so easy, and I positioned the extender in the downstairs hallway. I was amazed at of the improved reception! Every device now gets 100% reception, all with improved speed as well. Should have bought this a long time ago. Instead of moving my laptop around the house to find the best reception.
customer_reviews.author: Balrog

customer_reviews.title: Great WI-FI Extender
customer_reviews.text: Problem solved! I had a low internet signal in my bedroom (the room farthest from my router)- my smart DVD player said that it was about 50%. I set this product up and my DVD player said that I had 100% signal strength! This was very easy to set up. I just followed the simple instructions in the manual. My laptop did the set up with no issues. Streaming is no longer full of buffering- I can watch a whole show without pauses! If you have similar issues with signal in your home, do not hesitate on this item.
customer_reviews.author: SLKnut

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rural area and sometimes can't pull the greatest wireless signal strength. I placed this at a midpoint in the house and it definitely seems to help with keeping an uninterrupted connection. I split my devices so some connect to the extender and some to the router directly. I used to reset the router frequently and rarely have to do that anymore to keep everything going!
customer_reviews.author: gobby148

customer_reviews.title: Have to unplug it every 2 weeks? ?
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good for a couple weeks then got dog slow (10% of speed). Unplugged it, plugged it back in, waited a couple minutes and the performance was back. Am i going to have to do this every 2 weeks? And, I do not like the fact that it created its own network name with a _EXT added to the main router's name. Now I have to check my wifi connection everytime I move around the house. PITA. Stuck with it now. Making the best out of the situation. Hope this review helps you make an informed decision. When working, this network extender is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo Tony

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and utilize
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to connect a wireless camera located in my backyard,to my router.It is about 50 feet away from my router ,with 3 interior walls and one exterior wall in between.I have no wireless signal in my backyard at all. I purchased The Netgear N300 .It came with very clear instructions.It was easy to connect to my router with WPS.Very simple to connect my device to.The N300 has lights that make it clear and easy to ensure you have it located in a good area for reception,and to show your devices are connected properly and working properly.My wireless camera gets a great signal and I can now use my phone in the backyard as well when connected to wireless.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR N300 Wall Plug Wi-Fi Range Extender is great!
customer_reviews.text: The NETGEAR N300 Wall Plug Version Wi-Fi Range Extender helps get a weak WIFI signal from one side of the house to the other. Arrived quickly. Works well. I am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Holland

product_meta.title: NETGEAR N300 Wall Plug Version Wi-Fi Range Extender (WN3000RP)
product_meta.description: Model:N300 Plug-InThe NETGEAR Universal Wi-Fi Range Extender effectively doubles the operating distance of your entire wireless network and conveniently avoids additional need for power cables or device clutter on your office desk or home theater. WN3000RP extends your wireless network to include the area outside the range of your existing wireless router by overcoming obstacles and enhancing overall network signal quality, giving you the freedom to roam anywhere in the house and access Internet without worrying about coverage. The product was specifically designed to be plugged into an electrical outlet, and blends in nicely with any surrounding. It is compatible with wireless b/g/n routers, gateways and Internet service provider device. System Requirements: Microsoft,Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0 or Safari 1.4 or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher. Dimensions: 2.64 x 2.17 x 1.34 in (67 x 55 x 34 mm) Weight: 0.22 lb (0.098 kg, Security-Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA/WPA2—PSK) and WEP
feature_bullets: Ideal for extending WiFi to devices like the iPhone 5, Samsung Galaxy S3, iPad 2, and PlayStation 3. External antennas for better WiFi coverage

Extends wireless coverage, universal compatibility. Reduce mobile data plan charges by connecting to WiFi. May not be compatible with WiFi routers or gateways whose ﬁrmware has been altered or changed, including without limitation certain open source routers, or other WiFi routers or gateways with non-standard or outdated ﬁrmware
Easy to install - no CD required. TCP/IP, DHCP server and client, DNS relay. Extends wireless coverage, universal compatibility
Fast Ethernet port to connect home A/V devices to the network ; WiFi Technology :802.11n
Smart LED indicators helps find the best location for optimal WiFi coverage. Works with devices supporting Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS)

specifications.Operating System: Linux, Windows Vista, Windows XP, Windows 7, Mac OS, Windows 2000, UNIX
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars14,393 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
